018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.List;
021import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
022
023import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.OPTIONAL;
024import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.MANDATORY;
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
026
027
028/**
029 * An operator that evaluates the mathematical comparison between two arguments.
030 * If the arguments satisfy the comparison then the filter evaluates to true.
031 * Otherwise the filter evaluates to false.
032 *
033 * <p>The nature of the comparison is dependent on the {@linkplain #getOperatorType() operator type}.
034 * A standard set of comparison operators is equal to, less than, greater than,
035 * less than or equal to, greater than or equal to and not equal to.</p>
036 *
037 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
038 * @author  Johann Sorel (Geomatys)
039 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
040 * @version 3.1
041 * @since   3.1
042 *
043 * @param  <R>  the type of resources (e.g. {@link org.opengis.feature.Feature}) to filter.
044 */
045@UML(identifier="BinaryComparisonOperator", specification=ISO_19143)
046public interface BinaryComparisonOperator<R> extends ComparisonOperator<R> {
047    /**
048     * Returns the two expressions to be compared by this operator.
049     * The expressions can be of any kind.
050     *
051     * @return a list of size 2 containing the two expressions to be compared.
052     */
053    @Override
054    @UML(identifier="expression", obligation=MANDATORY, specification=ISO_19143)
055    List<Expression<R,?>> getExpressions();
056
057    /**
058     * Returns the element on the left side of the comparison expression.
059     * This is the element at index 0 in the {@linkplain #getExpressions() list of expressions}.
060     *
061     * @return the first element in the list of expressions.
062     */
063    default Expression<R,?> getOperand1() {
064        return getExpressions().get(0);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Returns the element on the right side of the comparison expression.
069     * This is the element at index 1 in the {@linkplain #getExpressions() list of expressions}.
070     *
071     * @return the second element in the list of expressions.
072     */
073    default Expression<R,?> getOperand2() {
074        return getExpressions().get(1);
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Specifies how a filter expression processor should perform string comparisons.
079     * A value of {@code true} means that string comparisons shall match case.
080     * The value {@code false} means that string comparisons are performed caselessly.
081     * The default value {@code true}.
082     *
083     * @return {@code true} if comparisons are case sensitive, otherwise {@code false}.
084     */
085    @UML(identifier="matchCase", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
086    default boolean isMatchingCase() {
087        return true;
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * Specifies how the comparison predicate shall be evaluated for a collection of values.
092     * Values can be {@link MatchAction#ALL ALL} if all values in the collection shall satisfy the predicate,
093     * {@link MatchAction#ANY ANY} if any of the value in the collection can satisfy the predicate, or
094     * {@link MatchAction#ONE ONE} if only one of the values in the collection shall satisfy the predicate.
095     * The default value is {@code ANY}.
096     *
097     * @return how the comparison predicate shall be evaluated for a collection of values.
098     *         Shall not be null.
099     */
100    @UML(identifier="matchAction", obligation=OPTIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
101    default MatchAction getMatchAction() {
102        return MatchAction.ANY;
103    }
104}
